Warhammer Space Marine 2, foi para mim o melhor jogo que joguei nos últimos anos. Não por ser um jogo que tenta ter um enredo complexo ou algo que tente atingir todos os públicos e acabe agradando ninguém. Esse jogo tenta e conseguiu se propor a ser simplesmente um jogo DIVERTIDO. Ele tem um modo companha, PvP e PvE e você vai se divertir com qualquer um deles.

A campanha é curta, mas não significa que é ruim, pois quantidade não é qualidade, poucos jogos conseguiram uma campanha longa e boa e são memoráveis até hoje. A campanha tem inicio, meio e fim, bem explicado e com personagens que vão te ensinar através de ações valores importantes para sua vida real, como honra, dever e sacrifício ( e para os mais religiosos a importância da fé em seu mestre/salvador). A campanha tem uma dificuldade natural, de você não conseguir porém você quer continuar.

Não joguei muito o PvP só o suficiente para pegar as conquistas, porém me diverti bastante o PvP é desbalanceado so que a graça é que não é pay to win, todo mundo tem acesso aos mesmos armamentos, classes e etc. Mapas bem construídos e fáceis de memorizar e jogar.

O PvE é um show a parte com operações que tem co-relação com a campanha, boss fights muito desafiadoras, níveis de dificuldades bem balanceados e distintos, cada classe que você escolher tem uma build de aramas e habilidades com estilo de gameplay completamente distintos.

O que me surpreendeu nesse jogo foi a relação da comunidade com os desenvolvedores onde, tudo está sendo resolvido da forma mais rápida e justa possível sem fan service ou algo do tipo.

Space marine 2 é uma perola do AAA, para quem tava descrente com o mercado de jogos, esse game é a solução. conheci o universo warhammer por causa dele, fiz novos amigos e depois de muito tempo afasto de jogos multiplayer encontrei um onde é saudável investir meu tempo.

Ah, mes petits enfants du Warp, installez-vous bien, car je vais vous faire une évaluation bien juteuse de Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 ! Vous allez voir, c'est une tornade de bagarre, de violence galactique, et de chaos spatial qui va vous décalquer les neurones comme une hache tronçonneuse dans le crâne d'un Ork. Allez, c'est parti, et on commence par les gros morceaux bien croustillants, puis on ira vers les détails un peu plus… piquants.

Les points positifs !

Une immersion brute, violente et épique
Vous entrez dans la peau d’un Space Marine, un vrai, un dur, un Ultramarine avec des pecs de la taille d'un tank et un amour profond pour le carnage méthodique ! L'atmosphère du jeu, c'est du Warhammer 40K pur jus. Vous n'avez même pas besoin de connaître l'univers pour vous laisser emporter par la rage qui suinte de chaque pixel. Les combats sont nerveux, les ennemis volent en morceaux, c’est une véritable danse de la destruction orchestrée à la perfection.

Un système de combat jouissif
Mais bon sang de Terre, qu'est-ce que c'est bon de taper ! La mêlée est d’une satisfaction totale, avec des animations qui sentent le poids, la brutalité, et ce petit « sploutch » bien gras quand votre marteau tonnerre vient se poser délicatement sur un Tyranide. Les armes de tir ? Des œuvres d’art en mouvement ! Le Bolter claque comme un canon de tank, chaque balle semble avoir un impact titanesque, et on sent bien le poids du matos. Vous êtes là pour décimer, et ça se ressent à chaque coup.

La horde tyranide : un cauchemar vivant !
Ah, les Tyranides, ces créatures dégueulasses et innombrables ! Les vagues d’ennemis qui déferlent, c’est un pur régal pour les amateurs de massacre en masse. Et là, mes bons amis, on en prend plein la figure : ils sont rapides, ils sont nombreux, et ils n’ont qu’un seul but, vous dévorer. Ça donne une intensité incroyable aux combats, car chaque seconde est un défi de survie où vous devez littéralement vous frayer un chemin à coups de Bolter et de tronçonneuse pour ne pas finir en repas de festin.

Graphismes et mise en scène à couper le souffle
On est sur du haut niveau. Les décors sont grandioses, colossaux, totalement à l’échelle de l’univers de Warhammer 40K. Les cités forteresses, les planètes dévastées, tout est détaillé, tout est majestueux, et la mise en scène vous balance directement au cœur de cette guerre infinie. Le travail sur la lumière et les textures ? Un régal visuel pour un jeu de cette envergure.

Un mode coop qui promet de belles heures de franche rigolade
Parce que oui, jouer en solo, c’est bien, mais alors fracasser du Xeno avec des potes, c’est encore mieux ! Imaginez-vous, trois Space Marines, chacun armé jusqu'aux dents, avec des stratégies bien primaire du genre « On fonce dans le tas et on verra bien après ». C’est de la coop à l'ancienne, honnête, comme on l'aime, avec de grosses sessions de déglingue entre amis.

Les points négatifs !

Une répétitivité qui peut poindre à l’horizon
Oui mes p’tits nobles du Warp, à force de massacrer des vagues incessantes de Tyranides, on peut avoir cette petite impression de « déjà-vu ». L'action, aussi intense soit-elle, finit par se répéter au bout d’un certain temps. Ce n’est pas un gros souci si vous êtes un bourrin dans l’âme comme moi, mais ceux qui cherchent de la variété pourraient trouver l'expérience un brin linéaire sur le long terme.

Pas assez d’ennemis variés pour l’instant
On adore les Tyranides, hein, c’est clair. Mais qu’est-ce qu’ils sont nombreux. Peut-être qu’un peu plus de diversité dans les hordes ennemies aurait été le bienvenu. On se retrouve souvent à poutrer les mêmes types de créatures, sans avoir l’occasion de changer de méthode ou d’approche. Peut-être qu’avec des DLC ou des mises à jour, on verra plus de saloperies mutantes, mais pour l’instant, c’est une armée de bestioles ressemblantes qui vous déferle dessus.

Narration secondaire un peu en retrait
Bon, on ne joue pas à Space Marine 2 pour son intrigue Shakespearienne, on est bien d’accord, mais l’histoire est tout de même un peu en arrière-plan. Elle ne vous accroche pas particulièrement, elle sert surtout de prétexte à aller fracasser du Xenos. Si vous aimez les grandes épopées narratives profondes et chargées d’émotion, vous resterez un peu sur votre faim.

L’absence (pour l’instant) d’un multi compétitif
Là, on aurait aimé avoir un peu plus de sauce, un mode PvP avec des batailles épiques entre Space Marines, ça aurait été un pur régal ! Mais à l’heure actuelle, le jeu se concentre surtout sur la coopération, ce qui est déjà énorme. Cependant, on espère que les futurs ajouts viendront combler ce petit manque et offrir des batailles épiques contre d'autres joueurs.

Conclusion
Alors, qu’est-ce qu’on en pense au final de ce Space Marine 2 ?! Eh bien, c’est une claque monumentale, une boucherie galactique à laquelle il est impossible de résister si vous aimez les combats intenses, l’univers Warhammer 40K et que vous avez toujours rêvé de jouer un Ultramarine avec un Bolter dans une main et une tronçonneuse dans l’autre. Oui, il y a des petites imperfections, mais on les pardonne aisément face à l’intensité du fun pur qui vous attend.

En résumé, c’est de la puissance brute, c’est épique, c’est grandiose. Et quand vous plongerez dans le feu de la bataille, rappelez-vous toujours : "A L'ASSAUUUUUT ! POUR L'EMPEREUUUUR !".

Saber Interactive saw the Helldivers 2 nerf controversy and must have said to themselves "Yeah, let's nerf the fun like Arrowhead Studios did." This is a classic Spongebob "How many times do we have to teach you this lesson, old man?" moment. If you want players to utilize specific weapons, nerfing the "more powerful" variant will not encourage players to use them, you're just making the weapons they've been using more frustrating to play with, so they are going to get mad at you and make fun of you for it. This is a big reason why the Helldivers 2 player average dropped massively following the Escalation of Freedom Update. I will never understand this balancing philosophy for PVE games. Space Marine 2 is a power fantasy, yet they are removing the power aspect from it.


I have played through the original 6 operations on Substantial and Ruthless quite a few times across all classes and never once thought to myself "Man... this is way too easy, I wish the developers would do something to make this harder." Let's talk about the nerfs specifically:



Translation: Fencing weapons are essentially as hard to achieve a parry as Balanced weapons now. If both types have the same perfect parry window "duration", then there is no reason to choose Fencing over Balanced now. This will not entice players to use Block weapon types, because I could argue that parrying is a requirement on Substantial, Ruthless, and now especially Lethal to avoid taking massive damage and restore armor when you're getting swarmed by enemies, Minoris and Majoris alike.



I never found Auspex Scan to have a significant damage bonus on Terminus enemies. It was a noticeable effect, but this is just an unnecessary nerf given how much health they have and aren't easy to kill even with Auspex Scan.



I assume they mean 'Melta Bomb' because that's what this equipment is called in-game, an item I felt its intended use was specifically for bosses or packed groups of enemies. It did good damage to bosses but it never was an instant kill. A 70% damage reduction to bosses now means there's no real reason to carry a Melta Bomb unless there's nothing else to grab and you're out of grenades. After reading this, I'm convinced Saber Interactive does not even play or test their own game. I'm pressing X for Doubt.





This is pretty bad news for anyone who enjoys playing as Heavy. Ammunition on Ruthless and even Substantial has already been scarce, and the Heavy is the class that is supposed to be the ranged powerhouse. Without ammo, Heavy is borderline useless since he is the only class that does not have a melee weapon. Majoris enemies on Substantial and above are very numerous and already bullet sponges.
The player's armor reduction is just another unnecessary nerf; armor values and damage felt reasonable before this update. Remember when a single hit from a Minoris enemy drained a full armor segment in 1.0? I thought Saber was on the right track after they tweaked that, but it turns out I was wrong.










I'm not opposed to a new difficulty, but it's how they have implemented it that I have a problem with, and there is no reason to attempt this mode other than curiosity and players going for 100%. Completing this across all operations rewards you with a damaged starting helm that you can use across all classes and a Power Sword skin. 2 cosmetics that don't even look good for overcoming such a challenge. The majority of players have yet to complete a Ruthless Operation so far, so I don't know why they'd even implement a Lethal difficulty just a month after the game's release; it seems like a waste of resources.
I already covered limited ammo refills, but I want to go over armour restoration: How am I supposed to restore armour as Sniper, Vanguard or Assault? 以下是根据游玩体验得出的一些个人碎碎念，仅代表个人观点。
本人首发标准版玩家，因为本身对40K世界观的了解和兴趣拉着朋友一起入坑的游戏。因为本身就是冲着PVE为目的玩的，所以在第一次难度下调前就靠跑图单刷以及与朋友联机的方式将所有职业刷到了25级并至少有一套圣物级装备。
个人感觉在最初版本时。难度主要来自于敌人过高的伤害以及医疗物资的匮乏，但是大部分的职业拥有热熔/榴弹、激光狙的过量治疗或者技能这样的额外恢复手段，虽然限制了配装的多样化和游戏一部分乐趣，但凭借着刷不同装备和职业的新鲜感还是有一定的游戏体验。同时也因为是新游戏，个人认为在后续的更新中也将会对某些较为弱势的武器或职业进行调整。
而后续的更新带来的平衡我认为是一次不错的更新，虽然过量治疗被当成BUG修复，但是怪物伤害的降低等一系列对敌人的削弱以及格挡小怪回甲的改动也给玩家增加了容错，同时使一些本来下水道的职业(牢锤：勿CUE）也有了游戏乐趣。这也使我更期待第二赛季的更新。
但10.17这次的更新不能说非常失败，只能说依托构式。更新后我与朋友进行了三把联机游戏，自己进行了三把单刷。
首先说说新版本的N5难度的新机制之一的连携回甲，在离开队友一定距离后包含强袭处决等一系列的回复护甲手段均不生效，这固然是鼓励抱团游戏的一种方式，但是军刀的设计师就和小脑偏瘫一样给了一个及其短小的距离，短小到近战角色冲锋开路时的一个突刺就会冲出距离，直接导致了“近战职业想要近战”、“远程职业想要在相对怪少的地方进行输出“就会出现回不了护甲情况，除非你的队伍构成为全近战或是全远程，否则至少有一个玩家是长时间处于无法恢复护甲OR摸鱼的状态下的，因此即使是和朋友组队也不会有很好的游戏的体验。
如果说N5作为给少数玩家设计的有挑战性的难度且刚推出不好平衡是有一定理由的话，接下来的改动也同时影响到了本来已经有一定良好体验的前四个难度。
更新了高难度下护甲的减少，N3 -10%，N4 -20%.这项改动使得玩家的血量容错率大概上回到了版本增强前的水平。本来对于我这样的玩家来说应该是影响不大的，但是配合下文的刷怪机制变动使得游戏体验更下了一层楼。
其次是刷怪机制的变动，在刷怪机制变动后精英怪物的数量明显有着巨大的提升，以N3.N4的炼狱为例，更新后道中的随便一条路上可能会同时刷出10个左右的一堆精英怪，且远程怪的攻击频率因为数量的巨大提升得到了巨大加强。如果说近战怪还能依靠熟练的弹反来在怪堆中无双，那么远程怪就和往你脸上扔屎一样恶心。接近两只手数量的精英远程有的在地上打满“铁丝网”限制走位和站桩，有的时不时来一发狙击出其不意，还有的不停射击散弹进行压制。上去尝试用近战，被切的目标在后撤步拖延时间的同时其余的远程依旧在对你进行巨量的输出和干扰。至于远程对射，除了榴弹和等离子这样的OP武器就更不可能在换血里赢过对面的怪海了。而上文提到的护甲减少，配合上制作组把发医疗包等资源的钱留给他妈买骨灰盒导致补给偏少等问题，一起形成了完美COMBO,大大降低了面对远程时的容错和承伤能力，使得体验进一步下降。
再加上发售时就存在的近战武器的近战伤害过低只能靠弹反强袭出伤害，爆弹枪全家幽默伤害这些的问题，官方在知道这些问题的情况下不作为，或者是用增加近战武器蓄力伤害这种几乎没有屌用的方法进行敷衍，更是大大降低了我对游戏的热情。
总体而言，我对当前版本的评价是：能玩，但没必要。
作为一个喜爱40K IP的玩家，游戏内容少我可以等更新，平衡不到位可以调整，我是希望游戏能越做越好。但对于傻逼军刀，我只想说，我玩这个游戏是因为它是40K的IP，你saber就踏马一坨狗屎，销量上去了人就飘了，属于是烂泥扶不上墙，是不是和隔壁WG，BVVD一样都不玩自己游戏的？什么吊样你自己看不到吗？该平衡的地方在那里敷衍，然后整一堆烂活试探玩家底线？ 2024/10/19/1:30

일부 몹은 난전 중인 상황에서 상대법이 너무 괴랄하게 다가옴.
대표적인 예가 조안스로프라는 대갈빡 큰 제노 혐오체와 쿠크리 들고 패링일까 회피일까 응 다가오지마 미사일 난사 패턴을 사용하는 스카라베 오컬트 터미네이터가 그 예임.

조안스로프는 한번에 두마리가 같이 나와서 한쪽은 무적 보호막을, 다른 한쪽은 풀기를 반복하면서 공중에 떠서 사이킥 포격을 조지는데, 이걸 상대하는 방법이 원거리 공격이 가능한 주무장으로 때리는 거 밖에 없음.
그래서 타이라니드가 나오는 맵에서는 어썰트, 불워크 같이 주무장이 없는 클래스는 사실상 주변 정리밖에 해줄 게 없어짐.

부무장으로 조지면 되지 않냐구요? 플라즈마 좀만 쏘다보면 배리어 키고 체력 회복하는거마냥 암만 때려도 기스도 안남.
근거리 공격은 공중에 떠있어서 맞지도 않는데, 회피 원툴로만 피해야하는 사이킥 포격들이 엇박으로 겹치면 피하지도 못함.

이 대갈빡 제노스컴들은 정타로 회피해도 반격 피스톨이 안떠서 딜 우겨넣기도 안되는데, 크랙 수류탄 뜬거 아니면 하루종일 굴러다니다가 죽거나 죽을때까지 피스톨 탄약 낭비해야함.
아군이 스나 장인이라서 보이는 족족 대가리에 구멍을 박아넣던가 표면을 멜타로 싹 태워버려서 뼈와 살을 분해해버리는 직업이 아니면 그냥 굴러다니면서 엉덩이 흔들고 죽어야함.

이건 애초에 밸런스를 잘못잡은게 아닌가 싶을 정도로 불합리함을 강요해서, 얘들 나오면 겜 하기 싫어짐.
6개의 클래스가 각기 다른 스탠스로 공략할 방법이 있어야 합리적인 어려움이라고 느끼지, 그냥 이 클래스는 저항하지 못하고 팀에 전적으로 의존해야한다 이렇게 되버리면 근본적으로 설계가 잘못된거임.

사우전드 선 터미네이터 마린들은 좀 덜한 편이긴 개뿔 체력이 높고 근접으로 쉴새없이 때려댐.
이걸 제대로 상대하려면 패링과 회피를 극한으로 해가면서 반격 딜링으로 방어력 보존을 절실하게 하는게 아닌 이상, 몇번 두들겨 맞다보면 회색 화면으로 쓰러지는 모습을 자주 보게됨.

이게 얘만 상대하는 것도 아니고 잔고어랑 저격총 든 헤레틱들이 사방에서 체력을 쫙쫙 깎아대는데 패링일까 회피일까 하는 그런건 의미가 조금도 없고 그냥 안구르면 죽여버린다는 생각밖에 없음.
거기에 루브릭 마린 화망까지 집중되면 눈 깜짝하면 회색 화면 떠있는 걸 볼 수 있음.

미사일은 궤도가 꺾여서 엄폐물 무시하고 옆으로 돌아와서 쳐박질 않나, 다가가서 때리면 경직이라도 걸리던가 바보가 되야하는데, 슈퍼아머로 무시하고 미사일을 근처에 난사함.
나와서 날뛰게 냅두면 방 박살나는게 한순간이라서 나오자마자 보고 폭딜로 죽이지 않으면 진다고 봐도 무방함.

근데? 우리는 저열한 무기 때문에 데미지도 안나오는데 적은 슈아에 방어력 보너스까지 받아옴.
빨리 잡지 않으면 파티가 터지는 데 빨리 잡을 수단은 없고 적들은 마구잡이로 몰려와서 엘리트 몹 겨낭하는 것도 힘듬
이러니까 그냥 불합리하다는 소리밖에 안나온다고 생각함.

릭터, 레이브너는 패턴이 까다롭다기 보단 패링과 회피를 너무 많이 요구하는 몹이라 패링과 회피를 강제하는 느낌이 너무 강해짐.
이게 가만히 있다가 덥치는 상황에선 문제가 안되는데, 워리어가 둘러싼 상태에서 패링 회피가 같이 뜨면 그냥 두들겨 맞고 죽는거 말곤 할게 없음.

레이브너나 릭터의 공격 회피를 제대로 안하면 고난이도에서는 진짜로 순식간에 암살당함. 쉬운 난이도에서는 방어막 하나 정도 소모되서 자력으로 풀려나는데, 3단계부터는 방심하다가 걸리는 순간 방어막 없는 상태면 그대로 황제님 곁으로 사라짐.

그래서 얘들을 상대하는 방법이 무장을 강화하고 내 피지컬을 극한까지 연마해야하는게 기본 공략법이 되는지라, 컨트롤에 자신이 없으면 아마 이것들 상대하다가 화병나서 겜 돈주고 산거 후회하게 됨.

이게 딱 둠 시리즈 느낌으로 특정 적들을 완벽하게 공략해 나간다는 성취감을 주긴 하는데, 이게 어느 기점을 넘어가면 그냥 회피 원툴로 피하고 쏘고 피하고 쏘고만 하면 되서 단순하게 난이도만 높은거지 재밌지 않아서 문제임.

Changing my review to a recommendation, with some caveats. The core of what's here is solid, but there are enough negatives that I have to add some points of caution to that.

Starting with the positives: the game good. Some of the guns are still somewhat lackluster in spite of recent tweaks intended to buff their viability in later difficulties, but it's still possible to get through the highest difficulties with anything on the table. Gunplay isn't the highlight here though -- melee is where SM2 shines. If you run parry-centric builds in souls-likes, you'll be right at home here. While there are non-parry focused melee weapon options available, one of the chief mechanics players rely on is recovering armor (think of it as a regenerating shield) through executions. It is also possible to recover armor by parrying small enemies that attack you ("minoris" enemies, as the game terms them) -- so being able to parry efficiently is one of the main ways to stay alive in this game. It's a blast in co-op, and frankly that's where I've spent all but two or so hours of time in this game.

I'm not the biggest 40k fan, but from everything I've seen they've been true to the lore of the 40k universe. This is likely because GW is intensely protective of their IP, and had granular input on seemingly pointless details like the specific look of ankle armor for the Space Marines. If lore accuracy is important to you, you'll appreciate this game.

All that said...there are some issues that are still in play.

Out the gate, the content for the game is fairly thin. The Campaign mode can be completed in roughly 6-8 hours if you're taking your time or still learning mechanics, and the Operations mode (where I suspect most players spend most of their time -- at least, that's the case for me) has 7 different missions right now. Each of those missions can be finished in 30-45 minutes, depending on how thoroughly you scour the environment for items. There's a PvP mode, but it's seemingly an afterthought that was just bolted on, because there's only three maps available there, and balancing there is .

In fact, the dev team for Space Marine 2 with the concept of balance in both PvP and PvE. Part of the furor over the 4.0 patch was due to changes that nerfed the existing meta strategies, without providing alternatives, effectively destroying the power fantasy aspect of their power fantasy game. Recent changes have moved the needle more towards this being an actual balancing effort, but there's still work to do.

Example: in my initial review, I had complaints about nerfs applied to the melta bomb -- a single charge grenade type deployable that was being used to deal massive amounts of damage to Terminus (mini-boss) and larger enemies. The approach taken by the devs was to reduce the damage these items do to those enemies by 70%. Thus, a melta bomb does just about nothing to a mini-boss, but a krak grenade will still take away chunks of its health -- and you get two krak grenades per pick up.

As I stated previously -- there's already a mechanic that limits the amount of damage a melta bomb can do, and it's called "item rarity." You start a round with three frag grenades. If you get a melta bomb, it's because the RNG saw fit to give you one. A melta bomb is supposed to be a big, nuclear option tool used to deal with big hordes or big enemies. If it can't do that job, what incentive do we have to take it?

Another issue is that this dev team has a habit of making changes to the game without documenting them. The problem here is that if the community has no idea what changes have been made to core elements of gameplay, it's going to be impossible for players to provide meaningful feedback on those changes, leaving us to just guess or go off vibes that something "feels different." If you're shooting from the hip and making changes to your game without telling people what's getting tweaked, you're setting yourself up for public outcry, and you deserve every ounce of grief you get in response.

fact, the dev team is fairly bad at communicating with users n general. Prior to the 4.0 patch, the community was told that the upcoming changes would include a new map, additional cosmetics and a new weapon. The map dropped, but the other items are still MIA, and so far as I've seen, the devs have not provided any information clarifying a different release date for these items, or an explanation for their absence.

Finally, there are still a handful of "little" problems that take away from the whole experience. I still occasionally see a bug where weapon XP is not properly allocated to the weapon used during a mission, meaning no progress is made towards unlocking the next quality tier for that weapon despite a successful run. Various classes and weapons still have useless (or borderline useless) perks, some of which can outright kill a player. The netcode has improved, but random disconnects are still a thing. Players on both AMD and nVidia cards have reported crashes at various times in the game's life cycle: at launch, AMD cards were having issues, but recently it seems to be nVidia users getting the short end of the stick. There's also the issue where if you're joined with a group via matchmaking and your preferred class is already being used, you're forced to pick another class (without an accompanying opportunity to make sure you've got an appropriate weapon load out for the map you're playing).

I'm having a good time with this game, obviously -- the number of hours I've played is plainly visible here. But I can only recommend this game with caveats. If you love 40k, like co-op PvE games, and don't mind dropping 60 bones on a game that's light on content, grab it. You'll have fun, and you can certainly squeeze plenty of hours out of repeating the Operations missions. I have.

If all three of those descriptors don't fit you though...wait for a sale. Just wait. I can easily see people getting a case of buyer's remorse buying this at 60. In all honesty, I'd recommend you wait even if those DO describe you. There's a good game here, but I can't say it's completely worth the price of admission right now. I don't exactly have buyer's remorse myself, but neither am I glad I spent that money.

To preface, my review was negative, due to patch 4.0 which introduced a bunch of changes a week ago at the time I am writing this.

Today we had another patch that reversed said changes, and after playing for a few hours, I can honestly say that Space Marine 2 is back in a good position again. This is of course subjective, but I am clearly not alone having this viewpoint.

I can't stop playing this though.

You have a campaign, which takes about 7 hour'ish to complete. While that might sound short, it is highly entertaining. The quality is top notch. At least I was having a blast blasting, hacking and swordchainsaw'ing my way through it.

Than you have the online part. As someone who is generally burned out of online games, this still has hooked me. You have PvE coop missions, called operations, where you and 2 fellow Space Marines clear out 1 of 7 maps. You can chose between 5 difficulties. The lowest one being very easy, the hardest one .. well.. hard.

I could probably write an essay about this game, but bottomline:
This is my years Baldurs Gate 3. Totally different genres, but both are game of the year content for me.

Also kudos to Sabre for listening to the community feedback. They reverted a highly unpopular patch in 1 week. They are also introducing public test servers. So this is apparently a company that listens.

About a month after Helldivers 2 launched, Arrowhead released a patch that made their game punishingly difficult and it was suddenly no longer accessible or fun to me, so I and many others quit. Their daily active players dropped off sharply after that. Saber has now done the exact same thing that Arrowhead did.

Substantial difficulty is now harder than Ruthless was before the patch with all the Extremis spawns and other tweaks. Ruthless and Lethal difficulties are inaccessible to someone like me who doesn't have the time to no-life the game and "git gud." That leaves me without the ability to progress, and without that I have no incentive to continue playing.

It was fun while it lasted. It's too bad this trend of Dark Souls difficulty fetishism is ruining games. What used to be recreational fun time is now far too intense and serious business. No thanks. I already have a difficult and stressful day job. I don't want or need a difficult and stressful game. I'm too old for that and I'd bet a lot of other 40k fans are, too.

Edit: Todays patch was almost everything I could have hoped for. Saber has proven (at least for now) that they actually listen to their customers and care more about whether we have fun than making sure their game is a torturously difficult Elitists Only gatekeeper circle **** like Helldivers 2 became. The rapid response and decision to roll back poorly designed and hastily implemented changes, with a few reasonable caveats, is appropriate and has returned the game to a state of play that is accessible enough to be inviting and enjoyable and challenging enough to be replayable. With that, Space Marine 2 has earned my positive review and recommendation, but I want to leave off my revised review with some words of caution:

Part of my afformentioned stressful job involves data analysis. Space Marine 2 is a great game that was almost ruined by poor decision making based on what I can only describe as poor analysis. Dmitriy Grigorenko, the Space Marine 2 Game Director, says in the 4.1 patch notes, "Here was our reasoning before Patch 4.0: When the game came out in September, the Ruthless difficulty win rate hovered around 60%. Weeks later, and with the changes introduced by Patch 3.0, we saw that the same win rate had jumped to over 80%, and we received a lot of feedback stating that the game had become too easy—even at its maximum difficulty (at the time)." Okay. Win Rate by Difficulty alone is a terrible way to determine whether or not a game is unbalanced unless you are also tracking the overall played time of the specific players involved, the weapons they are using, and the degrees and extents to which they've upgraded their class and weapon perks. Of course win rates on Ruthless jumped by 20% over a few weeks! The players were learning the game, learning the enemies, learning where all the equipment spawns, and progressively unlocking more powerful weapons and abilities! A full team of maxed out players (level 25 with fully upgraded Relic weapons) with over 100 hours played consistently beating the game on the highest difficulty should not be surprising or concerning. It should be expected. On the other hand, a full team of newer players leveling and unlocking their first class and weapon set should find it challenging, but not impossible. Saber seems to have looked at and listened to only the most hardcore addicted players and started tuning the game for that small but vocal group of presumably unemployed extreme gamers who compulsively devoured what was meant to be hundreds of hours of content and then whined when the game we were all still learning and progressing through wasn't hard enough for them anymore after they memorized and mastered every aspect of a game that most of the player base were just beginning to explore. As a result, Saber made PvE progression for newer and more casual players impossible (or at least prohibitively difficult) for a week. That's a really dumb thing for a smart team of developers to do.

I don't know how much data Saber is collecting or the different ways that they may or may not be analyzing that data, but this bit of insight from the Game Director is concerning without additional context. At least they did the right thing by rolling back their and they didn't take forever to do it. Hopefully they will make good on their promise to be more measured in their approach to balancing the game going forward by listening to feedback from more than just the most hyper-aggressive terminally-online game junkies.

Fan de l'univers depuis mon adolescence, ayant fait le premier à l'époque, j'en attendais beaucoup de la suite (peut-être trop d'ailleurs).

Premièrement, cela fait plaisir de retrouver l'univers dans un jeu à gros budget. En effet, depuis les déboires du dernier Dawn Of War, les grosses productions étaient frileuses.
En revanche, il y a eu plein de jeux à petits budgets ou indés qui sont des pépites.

Niveau graphisme, c'est vraiment très beau. Je n'ai pas grand-chose à dire de plus, le visuel de l'univers n'a plus rien à prouver.

Coté technique, il est réellement très gourmand en ressources processeur, j'ai eu du mal au début.
i5-8600K
7900XT
16Go RAM

Avant le dernier patch, mon i5 n'en pouvait plus. J'ai quand même plus observé l'efficacité du système de cache du jeu, bravo les devs. En effet, plus je jouais, moins j'avais de problèmes de performances. Cependant, j'ai eu de nombreux crashs à un moment donné en jouant au multi.

Niveau gameplay, c'est un retour dans les années pré 2015. Cela ne conviendra pas à tout le monde, mais la recette est efficace.
Il y a le même esprit que le premier, mais bien amélioré. Je pense aux exécutions qui sont jouissives, l'esquive, la parade, le tir et la parade réflexe. Tout vient naturellement. L'arsenal est assez généreux.

Niveau histoire, c'est dans la lignée du premier, épique, voire vraiment très épique par moments. Du bon W40K, quoi !

Niveau contenu, on reste dans les jeux modernes qui font les paris de tenir ou de faire revenir les joueurs sur un an. Donc, le contenu de base peut paraitre moyennement abondant.

Le multi je n'ai fait que la coop opérations et franchement, c'est réellement sympa à jouer.
Je pense que le jeu va me durer quelques mois, voire l'année, vu le contenu annoncé.

Pour les points faibles. Ayant joué au jeu depuis l'accès anticipé, je dirais :

- Les bugs, c'est chiant, on le répète : ne pas jouer à la sortie.
- Un aspect répétitif dans le gameplay : si tu n'aimes pas, passe ton chemin.
- La sortie des patchs et des features de base tardive, je pense au support de l'ultra-wide.
- On en veut plus.

Until they fix some major issues I'm done with this game. I'm convinced the game is single handedly being held up by the fact that it's a 40k game alone. If it were any other franchise it would have tanked day one. The game was already in a state that desperately needed changes and buffs, but instead they just nerfed the players to ♥♥♥♥. The coherency feature is just godawful and makes absolutely no sense in this game. Your forced to either stay with your ranged team mates on melee classes, or stay with your melee team mates on ranged classes. Forget about splitting up to more efficiently complete objectives or to flank enemies. Most classes have perk options that are obsolete and never worth taking. The game was advertised as a hack and slash type horde game, but the game punishes you for using a hack and slash style. The enemies are all reactive to you, so any time you start swinging your melee weapon or shooting, they are interrupting you with attacks, which you then need to dodge or parry, and while you're being swarmed in melee, there are 10 ranged gaunts and 5 majoris with devourers peppering down your armour, which you won't get back if you aren't within 5 feet from one of your team mates now, and then every 100 meters you travel you have to deal with an extremis encounter of some sort on top of all of that. The whole game is like a souls game fight, except with additional enemies. You make one mistake, you're downed. I thought this was Space Marines, not Space Guardsmen. I'm not a Souls-like player and I usually gravitate towards the medium difficulty settings of a game. So when I tell you that I find this game highly satisfying for the challenge it provides, take that as you will.

There are 3 primary game modes:

1) Campaign. The campaign is fun, but rather short. The game itself is highly cinematic, so it feels HIGHLY cinematic in the best way. Recommended to play with friends, as the bots are fairly incompetent when you need them most (the most annoying enemies, the mini bosses, and the bosses). There is very little replayability here, as none of the unlocking or leveling mechanisms in the other parts of the game apply to the campaign and it's very linear. But there are some amazing moments that I will literally never forget, so I recommend playing it.

2) Operations. This is a PVE setting somewhat akin to L4D or Darktide that I find to be the meat and potatoes of the game. On the scale of a lifetime gamer who does not revel in the hardest games or bragging about how good I am at hard games, I found this game mode to be VERY challenging. Here more than anywhere else, you will be forced to play a certain way in order to thrive. That said, the feeling of accomplishment I get out of winning rounds at the highest difficulties is very good, and there are a ton of crunchy weapon leveling mechanisms and class perks to fine tune.

A recent patch was released with some amazing free content, but also with a significant difficulty spike that catered to a loud minority of players. More than a mere difficulty spike, it sought to increase difficulty by making the player less effective rather than making the enemy more dangerous (it did some of both to be fair). The result for me was that I almost quit the game. Fortunately, the devs listened to the community outcry and reversed many of the changes in record time. To me the game still has not fully been returned to its former state of perfect balance, but I'm optimistic for future patches. Class and weapon balance is severely lacking (only 2 classes have effective ranged defenses, making the other 4 classes highly ineffective against the Chaos faction, which is heavily focused on range attacks for example). Still, on the balance, all difficulties are beatable and this game mode is fun and rewarding. When I need to let off steam, there is little more satisfying than parrying, pummeling down, and executing a Tyranid warrior or Lictor.

3) PVP. I'm not a huge PVP guy but I've played a few hours of it. I found it rather simplistic. You will play as a space marine or chaos marine, at random. Strangely, the incredible depth of customization that is available to your space marines is NOT available to you if you happen to get assigned Chaos Marines. There is a separate leveling mechanic in PVP vs PVE, which felt dissatisfying to me when I gave it a try after 100 hours of PVE.

Overall, this is a great game with a lot of flaws, deeply satisfying and often frustrating. The devs really listen to the community, which, as long as they don't revert to catering to the self-titled "hardcore" minority, can only lead to more positive growth.

Maybe, if we're really really lucky, we'll even get to play as Terminators one day.

É incrível como um jogo com tão pouco conteúdo narrativo consegue compensar com um design robusto e gameplay divertida. Como alguém que recentemente mergulhou nesse universo, os gráficos são impressionantes e direcionados a criar uma atmosfera caótica, tal qual é a vida de um Space Marine..

A campanha é curta, mas dentro do suficiente para a proposta do jogo. Com início, meio e fim, apresenta com bases memoráveis seus personagens. Seu PVE tem relação com a campanha e se destaca por ser bem desafiante em níveis maiores.

Já o PVP, ao menos no período em que joguei, foi um show a parte. Extremamente divertido e sem frescura. Todos os modos de jogo são bem feitos.

Talvez o único ponto negativo de desse jogo é a falta de uma trilha sonora que o tornasse ainda mais único em um mercado de padrões. Definitivamente, Space Marine 2 não está aqui para agradar as massas. Sua única proposta é ser divertido, e nesse quesito ele é altamente recomendável.

Conquistas/100%: Seu 100% não tem nada de complicado, a maior parte vai ser farm. Um destaque para a conquista ''Impiedoso'' que pode ser o grande empecilho para os completistas futuramente, com o tempo pode ser que se torne difícil fazer a sequência de abates no PVP sem morrer. A conquista ''Acabe com eles'' é recomendável que não marque os inimigos da campanha no modo operações (Há uma possibilidade de não contabilizar o inimigo no modo operações). Quanto a conquista de abater 41k de inimigos, existe um glitch na campanha bem fácil para se fazer essa quantidade em pouco tempo.

Campaign was good, graphics good, story good, operations good, pvp good. But I have one major issue with the game's progression of difficulty. Its feigned, or poorly executed.

TL;DR: Game felt good at first, but as you progress in difficulty, it loses it's shine.. The game's enemies don't increase in number, rather they increase in health as you go up in difficulty, so the enemies are spongier, not harder. This paired with the mechanics of survival on higher difficulty ruined the game for me.

Full explanation:

Instead of throwing more enemies at you, or more variety, they just make the enemies spongier, (give them more health and resistance to stagger.) Same enemy, same moves. Just now it takes 2-3 mags of ammo, instead of 1. Guns feel under powered/useless at higher difficulties.

On the 1st or the 2nd difficulty, you feel like an Astartes, you feel powerful. You charge into combat, your teammates don't need constant supervision. Your weapons feel powerful. Knock it up to 3 difficulty, everything still feels good, weapons are okay, but melee seems more effective.

You hit difficulty 4, all of a sudden your guns feel pretty weak, even gold tier, max perked weapons. Dumping full mags into enemies skulls, and having to reload before they give an execute window. Enemy attacks can nearly wipe your health bar, with one hit. (Speaking about Majoris/Extremis here, the small enemies are never really a huge issue, even on max diffy). Juggling armor charges becomes a chore.

Playing on 5's isn't even playing the same game. No longer do you feel like an Astartes charging into combat, now you're literally just running around scrounging for life stem's and looking for the ever scarce ammo,(which is now even more limited with caps on uses), for a gun that feels useless. All of this while probably roll spamming to wait for your teammates re-spawn timer. This was 9/10 of my 5's, just running for your life, while praying your teammates are doing the same and not dying.

Final Take:

Game was a blast for 40 hours, but if I gotta play like a b!$%# to play on the higher difficulty, that's not fun. Ill still play a 3-4 with friends, but it feels like a chore as I know this game is gonna end up in the uninstalled folder after month or two.

울트라마린 2중대의 이름으로 알리노라.

우리, 울트라마린 2중대는 제국의 방산비리 조사를 통한 자정 노력이 성과를 거둔 점에 대해 경의를 표한다. 오직 황제와 인류제국의 영광을 위해 싸우는 우리 아스타르테스로서는, 이러한 결단을 통해 제국 수뇌부와 아드미니스트라툼, 뮤니토룸 내부의 타락과 부패의 뿌리가 뽑히기 시작했다는 소식을 반갑게 맞이한다.

이번 감사와 조정 이후, 방어구의 품질이 개선되었으며, 또한 전장에서 전투-형제들끼리 밀착하지 않으면 파워 아머의 보호막이 오작동하는 문제가 완벽히 해결되었음을 확인할 수 있었다. 이는 전장의 최전선에서 황제의 뜻을 구현하는 우리에게 꼭 필요했던 희망이자, 제국이 우리와 황제의 뜻을 저버리지 않았음을 증명하는 신호로 받아들인다. 그럼에도 불구하고, 아직 더 나아가야 할 길이 남아 있음을 우리는 인지하고 있다.

우리는 볼터에 사용할 볼트의 품질 역시 어느 정도 개선되었음을 확인할 수 있었으나, 여전히 우리 아스타르테스 맞닥뜨리는 적들, 특히 카오스와 이단, 그리고 외계의 사악한 존재들을 철저히 소탕하기에는 부족함이 느껴진다. 인류의 번영과 제국의 안정을 위한 성전에서, 볼터 무기가 좀더 임무에 적합한 품질과 위력을 갖추어야 할 필요가 있음을 다시금 강조한다. 플라스마 무기와 멜타 무기는 예전부터 지금까지 변함없이 훌륭했으나, 플라스마나 멜타 무기는 볼터만큼 범용성이 뛰어나지 않으며, 그런 무기들을 항상 사용할 수도 없다. 아스타르테스 화기 편제의 주역은 그 영광스러웠던 시대부터 지금에 이르기까지 언제나 볼터였음을 기억하기 바란다.

우리는 제국 수뇌부의 결단을 환영하며, 이번 감사에서 보여준 단호한 의지를 긍정적으로 평가한다. 이러한 자정 노력의 지속적 실행을 통해, 더 큰 부패를 사전에 막고, 제국이 우리와 황제께 대한 진실한 헌신을 다할 수 있으리라 믿는다. 우리는 제국이 앞으로도 현명하고 결단력 있는 판단을 내림으로써, 황제의 전사들이 자신의 임무를 완수하는 데 필요한 모든 준비를 갖출 수 있도록 노력해 주기를 고대한다.

우리는 언제나처럼 황제의 뜻을 받들어 인류의 수호자이자 정의의 심판자로서, 황제와 제국을 위해 싸울 것이다. 황제의 이름 아래 부패가 뿌리 뽑히고, 다시는 탐욕이 우리 스스로를, 인류와 그 위대한 제국을 흔들지 않도록, 우리는 황제의 충실한 종으로서 제국의 자정과 개선을 위한 노력에 언제나 동참할 준비가 되어 있다.

울트라마린 2중대의 이름으로, 신-황제 폐하의 뜻을 받들어, 위대한 인류의 뜻을 받들어 우리는 싸우리라. 황제 폐하와 인류 제국에 무궁한 영광이 있으라.

Love this game, but the latest patch has significantly lessened the enjoyment for me.

Specifically, the latest mechanic that requires your character to be in close proximity to your teammates in order to both regenerate armor (after ~25s of taking no damage) or regain armor through combat (parries/gun strikes/executions), absolutely needs to be adjusted or removed entirely.

This mechanic is currently broken (or at least I hope it is not intended to be this way) when you are the last survivor in your squad. The game does not allow you to regenerate armor, PERIOD. Good luck trying to survive an enemy wave on Lethal difficulty for 300s as you wait for team to re-spawn. It should be turned off when you are the sole survivor.

I swear the distance required to be considered within range of your squad is shorter than the distance I can throw a Melta Bomb. It also seems like the 25s armor regeneration timer resets if you happen to step out of that range. This can cause you to be without armor for what seems like minutes at a time, even if there is no enemies around. You can only pray your brothers don't just run off while your back is turned to them because you're Eight Trigrams Sixty-Four Palming a massive Tyranid wave trying to survive.

Sniper gameplay is significantly impacted by this change. It's hard to gain line-of-sight of ranged enemies or maintain safe positioning away from enemies when you're required to be within spitting distance of your team.

Fans waited 13 years for this but incredibly, the game makes you feel like the wait was worth it.
Space Marine 2 is few in flaws and has plentiful amounts of awesome sections and details. The gameplay in Campaign and Operations feels very smooth and highly responsive. Control inputs won't force you to lock into an animation while fighting, so you can be swinging a melee combo one moment and in the middle of that press key to parry an enemy, and the animation will snap smoothly to parrying from what you were doing earlier.
Visually game is very impressive as well! I only spotted one pop-in in 18 hours and one model missing in Battle Barge (which was fixed by forcing a reload of environments). Some of the architecture in Battle Barge and Hive City is up to par when compared to what we got in Space Marine 1 and it was also stunning sometimes to walk around and admire the scenery developers had come up with.
Voice acting is perfect! It took me a few moments to get used to Titus' voice but it wasn't long when I was able to identify Chairon and Gadriel also while fighting Tyranids.
From acting I should move on to writing: as a lore nerd I found this game to be a great representation of canon lore, I felt a sense of brotherhood with Chairon and Gadriel, some dialogue made me genuinely laugh out loud and the final boss had couple of line deliveries that really worked for me ("pearls of wisdom" bit etc.).
All in all, one of the best sequels I've played and definitely lived up to fan expectations.

I want to like the game, I really do. It just seems very flashy with no substance. Some of the kills or combos are great, but beyond that there are only 7 maps which play pretty much the same over any over again.

Customization of your guy ranges from a Bolter that does no damage, but fires fast to a bolter that does a slight bit more damage but fires slower to stabby bits which are either dull, weak, or useless. You will have moments where you feel powerful then go back to dumping 49 bolter rounds into 1 enemy who then proceeds to murder you completely unaffected by the weapon.

You cannot interrupt enemy attacks, moves, or critical strikes, but they can interrupt yours. The best thing to do is use the Codex Astartes approved front flip instead of movement because it makes you practically immune to all damage and you can't outrun anything anyway. I recall reading this in much of the lore on how Horus kept front flipping to get away from Sanguinius till he saw 1 opening to win. It is like having the high ground except you look silly. 90 enemies shooting at you? Front flip till you get behind cover! Melee guys all over you? Front flip away till your team can help you. I believe this move was covered in Chapter 27 of the Codex Astartes to include perfect form, how to properly tuck in your belly, as well as not get your giant nuclear backpack to get stuck on rocks.

Your Emperor approved Power armor is great except occasionally you'll get tangled up in those weeds in your garden you can't seem to eradicate or random dudes firing flashlights at you to great effect. It makes you wonder how some Astartes can become veterans as it seems everything can hurt us greatly. "I fought in 100 campaigns! I was the first one shot in each mission and had to rest behind a rock till it was over, now I am the Captain because everyone else died 20 seconds later screaming something about glory. They made really attractive corpses though."

I suppose the game has some potential, though it isn't as customization as Darktide, Rogue Trader or Daemonhunter. Most the Astartes will look the same though in different colors. Or your weapons look like they belong in a BDSM dungeon you have to sign a waiver for to get access.

If they can get the wonky controls fixed, some power to our weapons (or give us more powerful weapons with more enemies), and some more maps this game has some potential. Right now it is good for about a month then off to something else.

The entire melee weapon roster is underpowered, in a game where melee is supposed to be the focus of the combat system.
(You can literally look up the datamined DPS values of weapons and compare them yourself.)

Half the class roster feels like it's filled with useless perks that activate on very conditional triggers and the PVP is an unbalanced mess that is already getting swarmed by cheaters.

If you really love warhammer then it might still be a worthy purchase, but honestly I regret spending money for a 12 hours long campaign that has no replayability whatsoever, coupled with multiplayer modes that also offer no replayability or reward. (other than unlocking new colours for your space marines, wohoo!)

At this point it feels like no matter how shallow a game is, as long as you have pretty graphics and speak against the "DEI Agenda" then you'll have a ton of gamers supporting your game and saying it's amazing.

Если кратко, то я рекомендую эту игру, она мне понравилась и о потраченных деньгах не жалею.
Дисклеймер. В обзоре может прослеживаться дилетантское отношение к вселенной, простые ошибки и т.д. Это вызвано тем, что я просто интересуюсь вселенной и платежеспособен, чтобы купить эту игру и кайфовать. Желания детально погружаться во вселенную нет, хоть она и крутая.
А дальше пойдем более детально.
Почему-то именно на эту игру захотелось оставить отзыв, так как игра не совсем однозначная.
Начнем с некоторого контекста. Я не являюсь ярым фанатом вахи, с некоторыми деталями вселенной я знаком, но и те из видосов на youtube:) Книг не читал, из игр немного играл в Boltgun и Inquisitor - Martyr.
Но вселенная мне симпатична. Так же я достаточно много играл в прошлое творение Saber, WWZ( к которой будут отсылки в этом обзоре).
Начнем с краткого обзора на игру, основываясь на моём субъективном восприятии:
Плюсы:
- Игра красивая, очень приятный визуальный дизайн. Дизайн локаций выполнен просто потрясно. Города ульи, прям вызывают восхищение, ибо всё просто огромное.
- Атмосфера передана прекрасно. Мрачное 40-е тысячелетие, во вселенной где война длится вечно, передано просто прекрасно.
- Уважение и любовь ко вселенной. Чувствуется что разработчики действительно с уважением относятся к данной вселенной. Потому что даже под самым жестким контролем со стороны Games WorkShop можно сделать низкокачественный продукт, благо таких игр по вархаммеру, которые находятся на дне стима очень много. В качестве примера: По сюжету, один из второстепенных боевых братьев получает тяжелое ранение и на протяжении всего сюжета, где-то на заднем фоне хаба его подготавливают к тому, чтобы стать дредноутом.
-Геймплей против тиранидов. Мне безумно нравится сражаться с данными противниками. В меру сложные, их много и получаешь удовольствие от крутости своего персонажа. Чувствуется что мы идеально оружие в руках Императора человечества.
-Очень понравилась фишка с разделение кампании и pve миссий. С точки зрения повествования, они идут параллельно.
-Pve миссии, они же операции. По факту, покупал игру только из-за этого режима. Так как мне нравится WWZ, то тут я ожидал примерно следующего:
Классы с уникальными способностями и вооружением, толпы врагов и кооп. Всё это я получил и в целом доволен. Ну и прокачка, нравится мне этот аспект, что ты играешь ради чего-то.
Минусы:
-Сетевое состояние игры. Я не знаю, что именно происходит, но бывает что выкидывает из игры, не подключает к лобби. Не так часто происходит, но когда происходит дико бесит. Такая проблема была и в wwz, так что к этой проблеме я чуть-чуть привык.
-Геймплей против еретиков.Это не прям уж минус, просто заметил что из всех операций, я играю только в те, где противниками являются тираниды. Геймплей против еретиков становится более тактическим, поэтому приходится переключаться из режима берсерка.
-Небольшой минус, это баланс. Видимо ядром игры были реализованы операции. Ибо там баланс противников и классов выполнен просто отлично. Что же касается кампании, то чувствуется, что она сделана с использованием такого же подхода, только классов у вас нет и оружие не прокачивается, что иногда вызывает вопросы.
-Закрытость PVE миссий, пока не пройдете сюжет. Ну это минус лично для меня, так как покупал игру ради операций с друзьями, тут же пришлось проходить сюжет. Такое небольшое ограничение немного разочаровало.
Подводя краткое резюме по этой игре:
Это великолепная игра по вселенной Warhammer. наверное лучшая в которую я играл. И просто хорошая игра со своими нюансами. Не стоит её покупать думая, что она прям как helldivers 2, это совершенно разные игры, которые дарят совершенно разные эмоции. Если вам нравятся игры с прогрессией, отличным визуальным стилем и минимальным порогом вхождения, то эта игра для вас. Если у вас по различным причинам не так много времени на игры, а вы их любите, то эта игра безусловно подарит вам отличные эмоции. Особенно если играть в неё 1-2 часа в день. Просто чтобы расслабиться. Захотите получить вызов, просто можете отправиться на более высокие уровни сложности. Однозначно рекомендую эту игру к покупке. На цену специально не обращаю внимания, потому что всё нынче дорого и пока вы будете думать, стоит ли эта игра своих денег, вы просто не получите нужное удовольствие. Так что постарайтесь сразу забыть о том, сколько потратили на неё.
